intro: Babiana blanda, commonly known as the white babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and fynbos vegetation, thriving in well-drained soils. Babiana blanda produces bulbs that store nutrients, allowing it to survive in dry conditions. Its blooming period is usually in late winter to early spring, making it a notable addition to gardens in temperate climates.
